title: Quick Tomato Basil Soup for Family Comfort

description: This Quick Tomato Basil Soup is a warm hug in a bowl! Made with fresh ingredients, it’s a delightful way to enjoy a comforting meal. Try it today and savor the flavors of home.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and garlic, sauté until softened.
Stir in diced tomatoes and vegetable broth, bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Add fresh basil, blend until smooth, and season with salt and pepper.
tips: For a creamier soup, add a splash of heavy cream or a dollop of sour cream before serving.

structured_content.content: This Quick Tomato Basil Soup is the perfect blend of fresh tomatoes and aromatic basil, creating a comforting dish that warms the soul. It's simple to make and packed with flavor, making it a family favorite.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 30 minutes
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for cozy weeknight dinners
  • Uses simple ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Great for meal prep and freezing

structured_content.content: I remember the first time I made this soup for my family on a chilly evening. The aroma filled the kitchen, and we all gathered around the table, sharing stories and laughter over warm bowls of soup.

• Main ingredient: Fresh tomatoes provide a vibrant flavor; use ripe tomatoes for the best taste.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Fresh basil adds a fragrant note; look for bright green leaves.
  • Supporting ingredients: Onion and garlic enhance the base flavor of the soup.
  • Equipment needed: A large pot and an immersion blender or regular blender for smooth texture.

upload.context: Preparation of the ingredients for the soup, showcasing fresh tomatoes, basil, and chopped onions.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Chop the onion and garlic, and dice the tomatoes if using fresh ones. Measure out the broth and basil.
Cooking Process:
In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat, sauté onions and garlic until translucent, then add tomatoes and broth, simmering for 20 minutes.
Finishing Touches:
Blend the soup until smooth, stir in fresh basil, and season to taste before serving.

upload.context: Cooking process of the soup, highlighting the blending of ingredients and the simmering pot.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Simmering the soup allows the flavors to meld beautifully.
  • Avoid overcooking the basil to keep its vibrant flavor.
  • The soup is ready when it’s heated through and smooth.
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days.

structured_content.content: Sharing this soup with my family has become a cherished tradition, especially during the colder months. It's a dish that brings us together and creates lasting memories.
Enhance the soup with a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese, a drizzle of balsamic glaze, or a pinch of red pepper flakes for a kick!
Serve with crusty bread, a fresh salad, or grilled cheese sandwiches for a complete meal.
For a vegan option, skip the cheese and use vegetable broth. You can also add roasted red peppers for a smoky flavor.

upload.context: Final plated dish of the tomato basil soup, garnished with fresh basil and served with bread.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use a high-quality olive oil for the best flavor.
  • Let the soup cool before blending for safety.
  • Serve immediately for the best texture and taste.
  • Garnish with extra basil for a pop of color.

structured_content.content: Enjoy making this comforting soup and feel the joy of creating something delicious for your loved ones!
